revision.text:
{{advert|date=January 2013}} {{Infobox company | name = Sumo Logic | type = [[Privately held company]] | logo = | industry = [[Computer software]], security management, [[Enterprise software]] | foundation = 2010 | founder = Kumar Saurabh, Christian Beedgen | location = [[Redwood City, California]], [[United States|USA]] | key_people = {{unbulleted list | Vance Loiselle {{small|(CEO)}} | Kumar Saurabh {{small|(Co-Founder & Vice President of Analytics)}} | Christian Beedgen {{small|(CTO, Co-founder)}} | Bruno Kurtic {{small|(Founding Vice President of Product and Strategy)}} }} | num_employees = | revenue = | net_income = | products = | homepage = [http://www.sumologic.com// sumologic.com] | footnotes = }}
'''Sumo Logic''' is a cloud-based [[log management]] and analytics service that leverages [[Big Data]] to deliver real-time IT insights, headquartered in [[Redwood City, California|Redwood City]], [[California]].<ref>http://www.eweek.com/c/a/Application-Development/Cloud-Analytics-Startup-Sumo-Logic-Exits-Stealth-Raises-15M-574795/</ref> Sumo Logic’s service provides timely and actionable information, gleaned from any type or source of log data, that not only helps solve operational, security and compliance challenges but provides critical business insights as well.<ref>http://www.dailydisruption.com/2012/02/disruptor-of-the-day-sumo-logic-harnessing-the-power-of-big-data-for-real-time-it/</ref> Sumo Logic was founded in April 2010 by Kumar Saurabh and Christian Beedgen, and received funding from [[Accel Partners]], [[Greylock Partners]], [[Sutter Hill Ventures]] and angel investor Shlomo Kramer.<ref>http://www.marketwire.com/press-release/sumo-logic-raises-15m-series-b-round-next-generation-log-management-analytics-1612992.htm</ref> The round of series C funding announced in November 2012 brings the company’s total venture capital backing to $50.5 million.<ref>http://www.marketwire.com/press-release/Sumo-Logic-Raises-30-Million-Series-C-Funding-Help-Enterprises-Drive-Actionable-1730970.htm/</ref>
==Technology== Sumo Logic’s architecture features an elastic petabyte scale platform that collects, manages and analyzes enterprise log data, reducing millions of log lines into valuable operational insights in real time.<ref>http://techcrunch.com/2012/01/31/log-data-management-and-analytics-startup-sumo-logic-raises-15m-from-greylock-and-others/</ref> Their cloud-based approach overcomes the inherent problems of premise-based solutions, including limits on scalability, inefficient or haphazard analysis, and uncontrolled costs.<ref>http://www.dailydisruption.com/2012/02/disruptor-of-the-day-sumo-logic-harnessing-the-power-of-big-data-for-real-time-it/</ref> [[Netflix]], the world's leading Internet subscription service for enjoying movies and TV programs, determined after exhaustive testing that only Sumo Logic can scale to meet the company’s multi-terabyte Big Data volume requirements.<ref>http://www.sumologic.com/follow-us/press/2012-09-11-netflix-selects-sumo-logic-next-generation-log-management-and-analytics-service.html</ref>
Sumo Logic is built around a globally distributed data retention architecture that keeps all log data available for instant analysis, eliminating the need for an enterprise to manage the cost and complexity of data archiving, backups and restoration.<ref>http://www.dailydisruption.com/2012/02/disruptor-of-the-day-sumo-logic-harnessing-the-power-of-big-data-for-real-time-it/</ref>
The service is entirely cloud-based and is maintenance free.<ref>http://venturebeat.com/2012/01/31/sumo-logic-raises-15m-drops-its-stealthy-status/</ref>
Sumo Logic modeled its approach on that of [[Google]], according to Christian Beedgen, the company’s CTO and one of its Cofounders. Sumo Logic uses advanced machine learning algorithms to whittle down mountains of log file data into common groupings, much the way Google News categorizes new stories distributed across the web, making it easier for administrators to synthesize the information.<ref>http://servicesangle.com/blog/2012/01/31/sumo-logic-emerges-from-stealth-to-take-on-splunk-log-data-analytics/</ref>
In June 2012, Sumo Logic announced Sumo Logic Free, a [[freemium]] full functionality edition of its analytical solution that is deployed on [[Amazon Web Services]],<ref>http://siliconangle.com/blog/2012/06/26/sumo-logic-goes-freemium-with-data-analysis/</ref> and in August 2012, the company announced Sumo Logic for VMware, which allows enterprises to search, visualize and analyze all [[VMware]] logs in real time so they can monitor and detect events within VMware virtual environments.<ref>http://www.talkincloud.com/sumo-logic-for-vmware-digs-deep-into-real-time-insights/</ref>
==Leadership== Sumo Logic was founded in 2010 by a technical leadership team with expertise in log management, scalable systems, Big Data and security, including: * Kumar Saurabh, Acting CEO, Co-Founder & Vice President of Analytics, formerly of [[ArcSight]] * Christian Beedgen, Co-Founder & CTO, formerly of [[ArcSight]] * Bruno Kurtic, Founding Vice President of Product and Strategy, formerly of [[Sensage]]
Vance Loiselle, formerly of [[BladeLogic]], joined Sumo Logic as Chief Executive Officer in May 2012.<ref>http://www.marketwire.com/press-release/sumo-logic-appoints-vance-loiselle-as-chief-executive-officer-1660745.htm</ref>
In April 2012, Sumo Logic formed a new advisory board, bringing in three [[Silicon Valley]] veterans: DJ Patil of Greylock Partners, and security experts Gerhard Eschelbeck of [[Sophos]] and Nir Zuk of [[Palo Alto Networks]].<ref>http://siliconangle.com/blog/2012/04/12/sumo-logic-brings-data-rock-stars-to-advisory-board/</ref>
==Patents== Sumo Logic’s service is powered by patent-pending Elastic Log Processing and LogReduce technologies.<ref>http://www.eweek.com/c/a/Application-Development/Cloud-Analytics-Startup-Sumo-Logic-Exits-Stealth-Raises-15M-574795/</ref>
==Awards and Recognition== In January, 2012, RSA named Sumo Logic one of its top 10 finalists for the Most Innovative Company at RSA.<ref>http://www.businesswire.com/news/home/20120105005264/en/Top-10-Finalists-Announced-Innovative-Company-RSA®</ref> At the April 2012 Under the Radar Conference, Sumo Logic received the Judge's Choice and the Audience Choice Awards for Performance Monitoring.<ref>http://www.undertheradarblog.com/?id=11</ref> In May 2012, Sumo Logic was named a Red Herring Americas 2012 Top 100 Winner.<ref>http://www.redherring.com/red-herring-americas/americas-2012-finalists/</ref>
==See also== * [[Splunk]] * [[LogLogic]] * [[ArcSight]] * [[Accelops]]
